Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay lets tackle this The user wants 20 open-ended questions based on the provided BPMN diagram of a smartphone supply chain The questions should delve into rationale improvements risks decisions communication and performance

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I need to understand the process flow thoroughly The process starts with market research and RD then splits into securing components from various countries After all components are secured theyre shipped to Malaysia for assembly Then quality checks packaging shipping via air or sea customs distribution centers and then various distribution methods Finally monitoring inventory and adjusting orders

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Now I need to generate questions that make someone think deeper about each step Lets start with the parallel gateways Why were those specific countries chosen for components What if theres a delay in one component How does the company ensure all tasks are synchronized Then moving to assembly in Malaysia why Malaysia What risks are involved in 247 operations How is quality control handled What happens if components fail checks multiple times Shipping methods what factors determine air vs sea freight How does customs clearance vary by region How do they handle regulatory differences Distribution channels how are local warehousing strategies decided How do ecommerce and retail distribution differ in challenges What about VIP shipments how are they prioritized Inventory monitoring how is demand forecasted What triggers order adjustments How do stakeholders communicate changes in demand Risk management geopolitical risks in component countries Contingency plans for supply chain disruptions Environmental impact considerations Stakeholder communication how do suppliers stay coordinated How are regional regulations communicated to teams Performance metrics what KPIs are used for each step How is supplier reliability measured How is customer satisfaction tracked post-distribution

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I need to make sure questions are open-ended not yesno They should provoke analysis and discussion Avoid SQL or technical solutions Cover all areas mentioned rationale improvements risks decisions communication performance

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Let me check if I have 20 Let me count 1 Rationale for component countries 2 Synchronization of parallel tasks 3 Choice of Malaysia for assembly 4 Risk of 247 assembly 5 Quality check criteria 6 Air vs sea freight factors 7 Customs challenges 8 Regional distribution center criteria 9 Local warehousing strategies 10 Ecommerce vs retail challenges 11 VIP shipment prioritization 12 Demand forecasting methods 13 Triggers for order adjustments 14 Handling repeated assembly failures 15 Supplier coordination communication 16 Geopolitical risk mitigation 17 Contingency for supply chain issues 18 Environmental impact reduction 19 KPIs for each process step 20 Post-distribution customer feedback Thats 20 Each question touches on different aspects mentioned in the prompt and the BPMN diagram They encourage thinking about reasons behind choices potential improvements risks involved decision-making factors communication strategies and performance metrics
